maven2-moduleset.description:
Build Nabla Visma nightly at midnight.
The main goals of this job is to do clean build fast, every day and provide quick feedback to developer.
It keeps build history for trend analyses.

Report as much as possible (like the equivalent continuous job):
  • tests results
  • coding style
  • formatter
  • pmd
  • cpd
  • checkstyle
  • findbugs
  • sonargraph
  • javadoc
  • cobertura/clover/jacoco
  • pitest
  • sonar
as soon it does not take too long.

For clover to work.
clean clover2:setup clover2:optimize test clover2:snapshot -Psample,arq-jbossas-managed -Dserver=jboss7x -U -Dsurefire.useFile=false clover2:setup install clover2:aggregate clover2:clover pmd:pmd pmd:cpd checkstyle:checkstyle findbugs:findbugs -Psample,arq-jbossas-managed -Dserver=jboss7x

For jacoco to work.
do not use org.jacoco:jacoco-maven-plugin:prepare-agent but mvn verify -Psample,run-its,coverage -Djacoco.outputDir=${WORKSPACE}/target

For pitest to work.
mvn install org.pitest:pitest-maven:mutationCoverage

For integration test to work.
mvn install -Prun-its mvn install -Dlog4j.configuration=log4j.properties -Dlog4j.debug=true -Prun-its,arq-weld-ee-embedded

For sonargraph test to work.
package -Dmaven.test.skip=true com.hello2morrow.sonargraph:maven-sonargraph-plugin:7.2.1:architect-report -Dsonargraph.activationCode=2356-F3B2-E2C6-CC70 -Dsonargraph.prepareForJenkins=true -Dsonargraph.reportDirectory=${WORKSPACE}/target/sonargraph-report -Dsonargraph.reportName=sonargraph-report -Dsonargraph.reportType=HTML -Dsonargraph.prepareForSonar=true

For codenarc report to work.
mvn codenarc:codenarc

info.scriptContent: cd $WORKSPACE echo "git.revision=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)" echo "git.branch=$(git log -n 1 --pretty=%d HEAD | sed 's/.*origin\///;s/[),].*//')"

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash -xv
#rm -Rf /tmp/cargo
sudo rm -Rf /tmp/.X11-lock || true sudo rm -Rf /tmp/.X10-lock || true
echo "SHUTDOWN_PORT : $SHUTDOWN_PORT" echo "CARGO_RMI_PORT : $CARGO_RMI_PORT" echo "TOMCAT_PORT : $TOMCAT_PORT" echo "JETTY_PORT : $JETTY_PORT" echo "JBOSS_PORT : $JBOSS_PORT"
# If Server is still running we will get its PID PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN=$JETTY_PORT
PID=$(lsof -t -i:$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN) || true
# -z is zero length (unset or empty string" # if NOT zero length => then kill it... if [ ! -z "$PID" ]; then echo "Found running Server at port: "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN" (PID: "$PID")" echo "I am killing that Server. A previous build seems to have gone wrong." # Kill it... hooray! kill $PID
else echo "No running Server found at port "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN". This is what I'd anticipate. Great!" fi
# If Server is still running we will get its PID PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN=$TOMCAT_PORT
PID=$(lsof -t -i:$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN) || true
# -z is zero length (unset or empty string" # if NOT zero length => then kill it... if [ ! -z "$PID" ]; then echo "Found running Server at port: "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN" (PID: "$PID")" echo "I am killing that Server. A previous build seems to have gone wrong." # Kill it... hooray! kill $PID
else echo "No running Server found at port "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN". This is what I'd anticipate. Great!" fi
# If Server is still running we will get its PID PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN=$JBOSS_PORT
PID=$(lsof -t -i:$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN) || true
# -z is zero length (unset or empty string" # if NOT zero length => then kill it... if [ ! -z "$PID" ]; then echo "Found running Server at port: "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN" (PID: "$PID")" echo "I am killing that Server. A previous build seems to have gone wrong." # Kill it... hooray! kill $PID
else echo "No running Server found at port "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN". This is what I'd anticipate. Great!" fi
#make version file FILENAME=$JOB_NAME"_VERSION.TXT" echo "$JOB_NAME: BUILD: $BUILD_NUMBER SHA1:${GIT_COMMIT:0:6}" > $FILENAME
#curl -i -v -k ${SERVER_URL}${SERVER_CONTEXT} --data "username=test&password=microsoft"
echo SONAR_BRANCH=$(printf '%s' $GIT_BRANCH | cut -d'/' -f 2- | sed s/[^0-9a-zA-Z:_.\-]/'_'/g) > sonar-branch

#!/bin/bash #set -xv
echo $'\u2192'
GCVIEWER_VERSION="1.35-SNAPSHOT" #See https://github.com/chewiebug/GCViewer #if [ -f gcviewer-${GCVIEWER_VERSION}.jar ]; then # echo "gcviewer file found" #else # wget http://nabla.freeboxos.fr:7072/download/gcviewer/gcviewer-${GCVIEWER_VERSION}.jar #fi java -Djava.awt.headless=true -jar /workspace/divers/GCViewer/target/gcviewer-${GCVIEWER_VERSION}.jar gc.log export target/gc.png || true
TAG=LATEST_SUCCESSFULL cd $WORKSPACE/ DOESTAGEXISTCMD="git tag -l | grep $TAG" eval $DOESTAGEXISTCMD if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then git tag -d $TAG git push origin :$TAG fi git tag -a $TAG -m "Jenkins develop" git push origin $TAG --force
#git fetch --prune origin +refs/tags/*:refs/tags/ git fetch --tags
#git show $TAG
GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT=$(git rev-parse --short $TAG) echo "GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT= ${GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT}"
#make version file cd ${WORKSPACE}/ FILENAME=$JOB_NAME"_VERSION.TXT" echo "$JOB_NAME: BUILD: $BUILD_NUMBER SHA1:${GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT}" > ${WORKSPACE}/$FILENAME
